repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Special Structural Adjustment
            Loan (SSAL) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome was rated
            unsatisfactory: the project's overall objectives were
            not met even though the specific outputs were all achieved.
            The project's sustainability was also regarded as
            unlikely: on balance the overriding factor was that the
            general political and economic environment did not bode well
            for continuing some of the specific fiscal, regulatory, and
            social sector reforms that had advanced well during the SSAL
            implementation. Nonetheless, under the circumstances, the
            performances of both the World Bank and the Borrower were
            rated satisfactory. Experiences with this new instrument
            demonstrated the following: The Bank successfully developed
            a "rapid response capability" to help borrowers
            deal quickly and effectively with unexpected, turbulent
            international financial and economic difficulties. The Bank
            could provide an important element of long-term finance when
            it is not available for timely support of urgent reforms.
            These lessons also point out that recent
            "graduates" could still be supported by the Bank
            during an economic crisis--even middle income countries with
            prior access to private capital markets. Although this SSAL
            allowed the Bank to respond flexibly and in an exceptional
            manner to Argentina's 1998 crisis, it raised some
            questions about the new instrument such as assumptions about
            political risk, and the ability to provide liquidity and
            manage grave external finance shortages while enacting
            structural reforms.

docna.cdata!:
Argentina - Special Structural Adjustment
            Loan (SSAL) Project

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Special Structural Adjustment
            Loan : Request for Inspection

abstracts.cdata!:
The Request for Inspection for the
            Special Structural Adjustment Loan in Argentina examines
            statements by the Requesters that claim that budget cuts to
            the Pro Huerta program have harmed and will harm the
            intended beneficiaries who are the absolute poor. The Pro
            Huerta program provides food and nutrition assistance to the
            absolute poor. The Requesters feel that, in conformity with
            the Bank's policy on poverty reduction, Pro Huerta was
            specifically included in the Loan Agreement as one of the
            programs the Bank considers must be protected under the
            social and economic program supported by the SSAL. If the
            Bank allowed the program to terminate, they would be
            violating their own rules and regulations. The Requesters
            list several violations by the Bank against social programs
            that were originally funded through the Special Structural
            Adjustment Loan.

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Special Structural Adjustment
            Loan and Special Repurchase Facility Support Loan Projects

abstracts.cdata!:
The loans will support the Government in
            the transformation of its economy and in turn protect the
            gains achieved thus far. The objectives of the two-loan
            operation are to prevent and mitigate the effect of the
            current international financial instability on the economy,
            and protect vulnerable groups as well. Nevertheless,
            preventive measures are advisable, and the Government has
            taken precautionary actions, such as restraining fiscal
            expenditures, and including an innovative contingent
            repurchase facility with private banks. Even though the
            loans will help meet foreign exchange needs, allowing the
            Government to remain focussed on longer term reform issues
            and safeguarding the economic and social achievements, there
            are risks, such as a delay in the upcoming planned reforms,
            or in the lack of restoration by mid-1999, of access to
            international capital markets, which wil make the financial
            package currently assembled, non sufficient, thus resulting
            in severe economic adjustment.

docna.cdata!:
Argentina - Special Structural Adjustment
            Loan and Special Repurchase Facility Support Loan Projects
